content: Stiffness in left wrist since fracture
title: Chief Complaint

content: The patient is a stay-at-home mom who sustained a left distal radius fracture in October 2023 following a fall. She underwent surgery with Dr. Andrew Rice and was diagnosed with CRPS post-operatively. She reports significant improvement since then but continues to experience persistent stiffness in her left wrist. She is unable to extend her wrist sufficiently to perform a push-up, although she can perform Pilates regularly without pain or limitation, using modifications. She presents for evaluation and treatment of ongoing wrist stiffness.
title: HPI Spencer

content: Incision while healing , minimal scar , excellent finger motion without painful post supination , uh , flexion to about 45 extensions to about 20
title: Musculoskeletal

content: X-rays show well-healed fracture with hardware, plate alignment looks good and overall reduction adequate
title: Imaging Results

content: - Left distal radius fracture status post surgery
title: Assessment

content: Discuss that patient likely will not have sufficient motion to perform a push-up.
Recommend advancing activity to return to Pilates.
title: Plan
